revised_title: Climatic Selection in Cepaea nemoralis in the Pyrenees
tldr: This study investigates the effects of climate on the shell color and banding polymorphism of Cepaea nemoralis in the Pyrenees. The researchers found that certain morph frequencies, such as unbanded and yellow, are favored in extreme climatic conditions, with cold air and low temperatures promoting these morphs at higher altitudes. In contrast, warmer and drier conditions seem to favor unbanded and yellow morphs at lower altitudes. The results suggest that climate can act as a selective agent in the distribution of morph frequencies in Cepaea nemoralis populations.
